Class Gui

java.lang.Object
  Gui
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener
public class Gui
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener

The GUI class creates the visible interface of the game and has the necessary methods required to keep the interface updated in response to changes. It implements the KeyListener interface in order to parse key input from the user. In also employs several dialog boxes combined with anonymous ActionListeners to respond to mouse input.

Version:
CS162 Final Project 06/02/2015
Author:
Solveig Osborne

infoPopUp

public void infoPopUp(java.lang.String title,
                      java.lang.String message)
Displays a message for the viewer via a pop-up message pane.

Parameters:
String - The title which will be displayed at the top of the pane.
String - The message which will appear in the body of the window.

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Takes keyboard input from the arrow pad, translates that into String directions, then calls the game's takeStep method to process the input.

Specified by:
keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
Parameters:
KeyEvent - The only key input that causes a response are the up, down, left, and right arrow keys.

resetPopUp

public void resetPopUp(java.lang.String title,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.String reasonForReset)
Displays message for the viewer and asks if they would like to reset.

Parameters:
String - The title which will be displayed at the top of the pane.
String - The message which will appear in the body of the window.
String - The reason a reset is required. Valid options are "dead" or "win".

skip

public void skip()
Creates dialog with a spinner allowing the user to select a different level number.

updateBackpackImage

public void updateBackpackImage(int index,
                                Block block)
Changes the pictures shown in the backpack in response to an item being added or removed.

Parameters:
index - The index of the backpack location to be updated. (This is set up to correspond directly with the item at that index in the backpack list held in the Game class.)
block - The block that corresponds to the item being held.

updateBlock

public void updateBlock(int location)
Updates the image for the panel at the given location. This allows the gui to update just the blocks which have changed instead of repainting the entire board.

Parameters:
int - The location of the block which needs updated.

updateGrid

public void updateGrid()
Creates the grid for the game board.

updateLevel

public void updateLevel(int newLevel)
Changes the level display panel to reflect a new level number.

Parameters:
int - The new level number.
